textBox.richText: Following a long drive we joyfully switched a rain soaked LA for a pristine blue sky Yosemite National Park. Whist the rain put a dampener on time in LA (which really didn’t matter given the fun with had with the Canadians) it was a blessing for our time in Yosemite. Usually at this time of the year the park is dry and the waterfalls run like a leaky tap. But thanks to the rain the park was in full glory with Yosemite, Bridalveil and Vernal Falls all cranking and the meadows sparkling a luscious green! Our first day took us up to Columbia Rock which was a tough steep hike (reminiscent of an episode from Man vs Wild - I’ve always wanted to be called Bear) through countless switchbacks. Luckily we spent up big at North Face during our shopping exhibitions in LA (reminiscent of an episode from Sex in the City) so our gear held us in good stead. At the end we were presented with some great views! Check the photo page for more. The park is absolutely amazing and the pics (while look good) don’t do it justice. Looking forward to the next few days and some more great walking!
